Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2012 07:08PM PoliceWife84 wrote: Blessings, What a wonderful ministry you are a part of! I underwent 6 months of chemo, followed by a year of Herceptin infusions, as I am Her2/neu positive. Personally, I LOVE full sized quilts - my cancer center is wonderful, but I always found the infusion rooms to be freezing, even in the midst of summer. My infusions would last from 9:30am till around 3:00pm, so - it made for a long day! Thanks for donating your talent and time to chemo patients - it is much appreciated! Love, Brandi
Posts.Title: Need Your Advice On Comfort Quilts For Chemo Patients! Blessings2011 christina0001

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2012 11:36PM PoliceWife84 wrote: Hi Meny, While I in no way have a remote vocal talent (I wish!), I have had 6 surgeries in the last 18 months with no issues whatsoever. My longest surgery was 12 hours, and my shortest was 4 hours. My only issue was a sore, scratchy throat after waking up - that lasted only a day or so, then I felt fine. I also had no issue with any sort of acid reflux or nausea. Now, the fatigue following those surgeries is a different story! You will do just fine! :) Love, Brandi
Posts.Title: General Anesthesia and vocal cords meny Cherilynn64

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2012 04:41PM PoliceWife84 wrote: I am so sorry to hear your news - I know you must be overwhelmed and scared. I just wanted to send you hugs, and let you know that you and your family are in my thoughts and prayers! Hang in there! :)                                                                                                              Love,                                                                                                                    Brandi
Posts.Title: So confused and heartbroken, stage lV? M-Aug M-Aug

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2012 09:54AM PoliceWife84 wrote: I also second the patch - my surgeon had me apply it behind my ear the night before each surgery, and remove it 3 days later. That along with IV Prevacid and Zofran before and after surgery, and I was good to go! No problems.:)
Posts.Title: General Anesthesia and vocal cords meny Cherilynn64

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2012 08:28PM PoliceWife84 wrote: 31 and a newlywed - only married 6 months. In remission 17 months and having the final stage of SGAP reconstruction in 3 weeks. I had TCH x 6 treatments, 8 wks of radiation, a year of Herceptin, and bilateral mastectomies. I know everyone says the first year of marriage is tough, but damn! I will say that my husband and I have weathered this journey together and have grown in faith and love beyond words. God Bless everyone!                                               Love,                                                  Brandi
